Description of incident: A portable device with personal information of current and former employees and some students was stolen.  The device had a payroll file which contained the information of students, faculty, and staff on payroll as of January 2010.  Social Security numbers, addresses, names, dates of birth and other employment information may have been exposed. UPDATE (9/18/10): Additionally details reveal that the information was not encrypted.  Approximately 2,270 students were affected.  Four thousand of the Social Security numbers on the device were from faculty or staff, while three were from students.  The banking information of two employees was also on the device.
